intro: Monanthotaxis kenyensis, commonly known as the Kenyan monanthotaxis, is a flowering plant native to Kenya. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks or in forest understories. Its botanical features include a slender stem and palmate leaves with a rough texture. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
